item.title: Starter Items
item.dc:creator: @chrham2 chrham2
item.description:
@chrham2 wrote:

[quote=“Kubanito, post:9, topic:253323”]add,

public int starterItems;

in Player.java

EDIT:

Also, so people don’t have to do ::starter, or ::starterItems,

Add this in your Initialize void.

showInterface(3559); apset = true; addItem(1323,1); addItem(995,5000); addItem(861,1); addItem(884,100); addItem(558,100); addItem(556,100); addItem(379,1); addItem(379,1); addItem(379,1); addItem(379,1); addItem(380,50); starterItems =+ 1; sendMessage("Welcome, I see you are a new player to ChrhamScape"); newWelc(); [/quote]

Omg, that didnt work either, i think i stay to ::starter istead then

Read full topic

item.title: Starter Items
item.dc:creator: @Kubanito Kubanito
item.description:
@Kubanito wrote:

add,

public int starterItems;

in Player.java

EDIT:

Also, so people don’t have to do ::starter, or ::starterItems,

Add this in your Initialize void.

		        showInterface(3559);
			apset = true;
			addItem(1323,1);
			addItem(995,5000);
			addItem(861,1);
			addItem(884,100);
			addItem(558,100);
			addItem(556,100);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(380,50);
			starterItems =+ 1;
			sendMessage("Welcome, I see you are a new player to ChrhamScape");
			newWelc();

item.title: Starter Items
item.dc:creator: @chrham2 chrham2
item.description:
@chrham2 wrote:

EDIT
[shadow=red,left]When I log on i should get the items![/shadow]
END OF EDIT
Ok, I want to have Starter Items instead of ::starter, so i made that, but i get the items again if i log out and in: Here’s my codes:

 if (starterItems == 0) {
			showInterface(3559);
			apset = true;
			addItem(1323,1);
			addItem(995,5000);
			addItem(861,1);
			addItem(884,100);
			addItem(558,100);
			addItem(556,100);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(379,1);
			addItem(380,50);
			starterItems =+ 1;
			sendMessage("Welcome, I see you are a new player to ChrhamScape");
			newWelc();
	}
     } else if (token.equals("character-starterItems")) {
     starterItems = Integer.parseInt(token2);
            characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-starterItems = ", 0, 25);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starterItems), 0, Integer
					.toString(starterItems).length());

Any Clue to solve the problem?
